column5: Looks like a trip down yonder will cost me a lot more than.

GCD, you are so lucky to able to fish year round and I am so jealous just looking at your crappie (LOL)! Do you ever just use plastic by itself without the minnow? And how do you take the pictures when you are alone?
Thanks for the great report G.  Those are some nice slabs  Joey
it really does hurt to see warm weather and softwater..and fish to boot....  oh well our rodent didn't see it's shadow so it won't be long...

Awesome stuff Dawg, always good to see your softwater fish'n tales  We've got snow up to our eyebrows and another 4-6" on the way today, so your reports offer   some much needed relief from the shovelling
Eee doggies, Greencoach, dem's big Crappies! Gotta give it to the Sabiki rig.  By the way, what exactly is a Sabiki Rig?
Kabuki rigs?...Whew for a minute I thought you said Bukake rigs.Dont wanna see that! Joe
Do tell, do tell Joe, what is buka, whatever.
Glad to see ya out harassing the fish population Glen.  Thanks for sharing!

Thanks for explaining the picture part. Sounds like alot of work. We all here really appreciate your pictures. BTW, you can always buy a fish towel and wash it after every outing. That way Ol' Yeller will know that you did go fishing.
Great day for sure Glen. Those are some very nice fish. What was the bait of choice?

Says you  started the day by drifting  minnow tipped sabiki.....nothing about catching fish the whole day on any particular bait, Gen'ral. And dat's a real nice smile there Gen'ral. Congrats to your dentist.
Great looking fish Glen any day you can get out is a good day  rob

Dats a real nice report there Bubba nice looking healthy fish and much better than I have been doing lately.  Are those Crappies really that big or are you still short  BTW you should invest in one of those fishing towels instead of always wipin your hands on the right side of your pants.  Another report but always the same wet spot  What good is a side console without a windsheild wiper.  Good Fishin Bubba nice crappies
Yeah... them's some fine crappies fo'sho'.
Great report Glen. Love to see the boat pics and open blue water.  O ya put 2 depends on for those days when you drink too much.
Roy, I just looked at the pictures and didn't read all the posts, but I think that Glen caught at least some of the fish on Kabuki rigs.  .  Pay attention.
Well done Glen. Wish we could get crappie that big around here.....
great report glen, thanks for sharing.
Nice fish Glen!!   Do you have to keep showing off and tormenting us with all that warmth and sunshine??
Wow.. White Crappie? Find one..you'll find twenty!     Try a flyrod with a little white marabou wetfly yet?
Nice going Glen! Looks like your having a good time out on bama waters eh. Guess its only a matter of time till ya loose the shirt, I am savoring every moment till then
Freshwater reports in Feb. Darnation, you Southern guys have it good...  Mike

I wasn't sure who's report this was at first....it was the all those clothes.....when I saw this picture, it all came back to me!  You look that blurry in real life, so it was easy to figure it out.  Great report Glen...very thankful for these soft water reports!!!  Bly laughed at me tonight for putting all my steelhead gear in a new chest pack...LOL.  Gotta get ready for the spring run in oh...8 weeks or so....haha.

Try Scugog, that lake is full of big crappie, i've got a few over 13" already this winter... biggest being 14", not sure the weight, but definitely 1.5 lbs for sure.    Nice looking fish you've got there Greencoachdog. i can't wait to get out on the soft water. 3 more months to go!

We'll be out there for the Tyler event, but other than that, I cant see a lot of ice fishing in my future.  I may try a few more times before ice out however.  Keep your reports coming though Glen...they are always a great read!
....Thanks Glen, the entertainment never fails to entertain. Oh and some nice dang fish you gots there!
Some nice lookin' slabs there for sure.  And some great variety!  How's the fight on dem der landlocked stripers?  reefrunner
